concept.title: Choosing Technical Electives
concept.shortdesc: Students within the ISyE major are required to take at least five (5) technical elective courses to earn their degree. These courses allow a student to build a speciality area, or focus, into their program, which can prepare them for their desired career. Typically, juniors need this guidance as most of their technical courses are taken in their senior year, as shown in the ISyE four-year sample program.

ol.li: Print the student's current Academic Process Audit Summary (APAS) report.
From the APAS report, verify which entry level ISyE required courses have been completed.

Mark off the student's completed courses on the ISyE four-year sample program. This guide will provide students with an easy-to-read planning tool to determine when they will register for their chosen technical elective courses..

To gain an understanding of a student's career interests, start by asking any of these questions:
What courses have you enjoyed?
What courses have you not enjoyed?
What courses do you feel you excelled in?
Have you had any internship experience? If so, where and what was your job title?
Then pull out the Technical Electives list. Based on the student's answers from the questions above, begin to narrow down the course options that match with their interests.

If necessary, pull out the Career Services guide and run down the example job titles typical of ISyE graduates. Use the student's responses to further narrow down which courses they should take and what internship opportunities they should consider.
NOTE: Sometimes it helps to read through course descriptions with the student for each technical elective of interest. Consider leaving the student with five or six courses to mull over in the time after the advising appointment. Suggest they make a follow-up appointment within ten (10) days of the date of the current appointment.
Provide the student with the Technical Elective form.
Log the meeting notes into APLUS.
If there are any follow-up communications, either schedule or perform them.

row.entry: When are Technical Elective forms due?
Each student's Technical Elective form needs to be completed by the last day of their junior year, or two semesters prior to their intended graduation day.
